articles.title: Loud talking can leave thousands of coronavirus droplets in air for 14 minutes - Mirror Online
articles.description: Talking at a loud volume can release thousands of coronavirus droplets per second, researchers at the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases in Maryland have found
articles.content:
Loud talking can leave coronavirus lingering in the air for much longer than previously thought, scientists say.
A US study claims that infected people can release thousands of droplets when speaking, which can then remain airborne for up to 14 minutes.

articles.description: There are a total of 75,855 COVID-19 cases throughout the country. The Canadian death toll stands at 5,679, while 37,808 have recovered from the virus.
articles.content:
Canada saw 1,253 new confirmed cases of COVID-19 — the disease caused by the novel coronavirus — and 117 new deaths on Saturday, bringing the national death toll to 5,679.

articles.title: Startling study shows how easy it is to spread coronavirus at restaurants - Express
articles.description: CORONAVIRUS continues to affect our lives and, for many Britons, fantasies of enjoying a delicious meal in a restaurant have been sadly shattered. A new experiment shows just how easily the virus is spread through utensils, phones and faces.
